definition: hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
Big Mac Index, a measure of the purchasing power parity (PPP) between currencies
pinyin: Ju4 wu2 ba4 han4 bao3 bao1 Zhi3 shu4

sentences.english: Ford (F, Fortune 500) is the 800-pound gorilla of the taxi business.
sentences.chinese: 福特可谓出租车行业的巨无霸。

sentences.english: The huge cake was about 720 meters long with a total weight of more than nine tons.
sentences.chinese: 这个蛋糕巨无霸长约720米，总重超过9吨。

sentences.english: The third column calculates Big Mac PPPs.
sentences.chinese: 第三列是巨无霸购买力平价。

sentences.english: Sprawling conglomerates are just as hard to manage as turbo-charged investment banks.
sentences.chinese: 任其发展的巨无霸就像开足马力的投行一样难以管理。

sentences.english: The aircraft they used for last flight was a jumbo jet.
sentences.chinese: 他们用巨无霸的喷射客机作为上个航次飞行机种。

sentences.english: I’d like a big Mac，but hold the cheese.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一个巨无霸，但是别放奶酪。

sentences.english: B：I want a Big Mac， a smallsgroupsof French fries and a medium coke.
sentences.chinese: 我要一个巨无霸，一份小薯条和一中杯可口可乐。

definition: a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
tycoon/magnate/big player (including company, country, school etc)/big shot
